WorkItem.Description:
Repro steps:
 
Start editing a data grid text column.
Right click the column.
 
Results:
 
1) The data grid exits edit mode for the cell
2) The text box context menu pops up with "Copy" and "Cut" disabled.
 
Actual results:
 
1) The data grid should stay in edit mode
2) The text box context menu should have "Copy" and "Cut" enabled.
WorkItem.Summary: Bringin up the context menu for a DataGridTextColumn causes cell edit mode to be exited

Comments.Message:
Hi scottwis,

We agree that this is a bug.  We're filing a bug in our internal database to track this and it will be fixed in a future release.

Thanks,
Samantha

Samantha, do you know of any workarounds for this issue?

Thanks

I haven't had an opportunity to try this myself so I'm not positive if it works, but theoretically you should be able to handle one of the mouse input events (PreviewMouseDown?) to manually take the mouse input and handle popping open the context menu and make sure that you stay in edit mode.

Hi Samantha, I found a solution that seems to work and is a bit simpler than handling the click event. In the DataGrid CellEditEnding event I check to see if the EditingElement is a TextBox, and if it is, and it's ContextMenu.IsOpen flag is set to true, I just cancel the Edit Ending event and it works.

One problem I am having is that by default the ContextMenu property of a TextBox is null. I think there is some sort of default context menu handler that handles the event and shows the popup. However this means that my solution only works if I explicitly create a context menu and assign it to this textbox (in the PreparingCellForEdit event)  or assign one in the style for the EditingElement for TextBox columns. 

I'm alright with this, but I would prefer not to use a custom ContextMenu, but to instead explicitly assign the default context menu for text boxes. 

Do you know how to get a reference to that (the default context menu for text boxes)?
I have just encountered this problem too,really annoying.thanks,hope this will be fixed in next release.
